snippet: Prosecutors said that they could not prove beyond a reasonable doubt that the conduct in those cases, which stemmed from the first mass arrests of the movement, was illegal.
abstract: Prosecutors in Manhattan drop charges against nearly two dozen people picked up in the first mass arrest of Occupy Wall Street demonstrators, saying they could not prove beyond a reasonable doubt that their conduct was illegal
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors said that they could not prove beyond a reasonable doubt that the conduct in those cases, which stemmed from the first mass arrests of the movement, was illegal.

headline.seo: Charges Against 21 Occupy Wall Street Protesters Are Dropped
headline.main: Charges Dropped for Some Occupy Wall Street Protesters
